span.style: font-size: medium; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

strong.style: font-size: medium; font-family: Arial; text-align: center;
strong.span:
The Shelton School District is now closed through at least the end of the school year, and possibly longer if directed otherwise by the governor.
This includes all before and after school activities.

strong.style: font-size: medium; font-family: Arial; text-align: center;

span.span: to see Shelton School District Board member, Sally Karr, discuss tips for the distance learning model we are implementing for the rest of the 19/20 school year.

hr.span: We will continue to provide regular updates on our Coronavirus Updates & Resources webpage. Please check our website frequently. You will also find a Q & A webpage which we hope will answer many of your questions. There are still many unknowns, but we thank you for your patience, understanding, and support as we all work through this challenging time together.

                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_0","title":"04/17/2020: Distance-Learning","content":"

Dear Families, Students, and Staff,



Our staff has been working diligently over the past couple of weeks surveying families and thinking outside of the box to deliver relevant, meaningful, and equitable learning experiences for all students. Next week, each school will begin a distance-learning model for the remainder of the school year.



We realize that there are many obstacles that our families and staff must overcome as we transition to distance-learning. Many families do not have internet access, parents are working from home, and some students have multiple roles at home. We have taken these obstacles into consideration and we will give our students plenty of grace during this time. This is new for all of us, and our plan is to roll-out our distance-learning model in a steady, methodical way, and adapt as needed.



CLICK HERE to see Shelton School District Board member, Sally Karr, discuss tips for the distance-learning model we are implementing for the rest of the 19/20 school year.



Each school will operate a little differently from each other to support the needs of their students as we transition to distance-learning. We will be providing another opportunity for families to sign-out Chromebooks at each school during the packet distribution times. Details are listed in each school’s distance-learning plan. Please note that it is not required that you sign-out a Chromebook from your home-school.  You may sign-out a Chromebook at any location.



CLICK HERE to view your school's distance-learning plan and Chromebook sign-out information.



Our teachers are eager to start teaching, and our staff is here to support student learning and we will do all we can to help our students and families through this time. We miss you and we are excited to begin engaging your learning in different ways.



Sincerely,



Alex Apostle





Estimadas familias, estudiantes y personal,



Nuestro personal ha estado trabajando diligentemente durante las últimas semanas encuestando a las familias y pensando de manera innovadora para proporcionar experiencias de aprendizaje relevantes, significativas y equitativas para todos los estudiantes. La próxima semana, cada escuela comenzará un modelo de aprendizaje a distancia para el resto del año escolar.



Nos damos cuenta de que hay muchos obstáculos que nuestras familias y el personal deben superar a medida que hacemos la transición al aprendizaje a distancia. Muchas familias no tienen acceso a internet, los padres trabajan desde casa y algunos estudiantes tienen múltiples roles en casa. Hemos tenido en cuenta estos obstáculos y les daremos a nuestros estudiantes mucha gracia durante este tiempo. Esto es nuevo para todos nosotros, y nuestro plan es implementar nuestro modelo de aprendizaje a distancia de una manera metódica y consistente, y adaptarlo según sea necesario.



Cada escuela operará de manera un poco diferente entre sí para satisfacer las necesidades de sus estudiantes a medida que hacemos la transición al aprendizaje a distancia. Brindaremos otra oportunidad para que las familias firmen Chromebooks en cada escuela. Los detalles se enumeran en el plan de aprendizaje a distancia de cada escuela. Tenga en cuenta que no necesita cerrar sesión en un Chromebook de su escuela de origen. Puede cerrar sesión en un Chromebook en cualquier lugar.



Haga clic aquí para ver el plan de aprendizaje a distancia de su escuela y la información de cierre de sesión de Chromebook



Nuestros maestros están ansiosos por comenzar a enseñar, y nuestro personal está aquí para apoyar el aprendizaje de los estudiantes y haremos todo lo posible para ayudar a nuestros estudiantes y familias durante este tiempo. Te extrañamos y estamos entusiasmados de comenzar a involucrar tu aprendizaje de diferentes maneras.



Alex Apostle","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_1","title":"04/14/2020: School Board Meetings","content":"
School board meetings will now be streamed live via YouTube every 2nd & 4th Tuesday of the month at 6:00 PM. Community members may make comments by sending an email to SchoolBoard@sheltonschools.org. Comments will be read at the beginning of the meeting, and another opportunity will be given at the end of the meetings as if the meeting was in person.

 

Links for the meeting on YouTube streaming:

Primary: https://youtu.be/Jp2-zww6Fr4 

Alternative if the Primary link is not working:

https://www.youtube.com/user/SheltonSchoolDist

(Look for the header for 4/14 School Board Meeting)


Las reuniones de la junta escolar ahora se transmitirán en vivo a través de YouTube cada 2º y 4º martes del mes a las 6:00 p.m. Los miembros de la comunidad pueden hacer comentarios enviando un correo electrónico a SchoolBoard@sheltonschools.org. Los comentarios se leerán al comienzo de la reunión, y se dará otra oportunidad al final de las reuniones como si la reunión fuera en persona.



Enlaces para la reunión en YouTube:

Primario: https://youtu.be/Jp2-zww6Fr4

Alternativa si el enlace primario no funciona:

https://www.youtube.com/user/SheltonSchoolDist

(Busque el encabezado para la reunión de la Junta Escolar del 4/14)




","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_2","title":"04/10/2020: Moving Forward","content":"CLICK HERE for Dr. Apostle's weekly radio interview with Jeff Slakey.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_3","title":"04/07/2020: Chromebook Sign-Outs & Food Distribution","content":"
CHROMEBOOK SIGN-OUT
For the week of Spring break, we are offering one Chromebook pick up date, Thursday from 4 PM - 7 PM at Oakland Bay Jr. High.





Students who do not already have a computer or Chromebook for use at home may check one out. Please be aware that you must have internet access to use a Chromebook. Parents must sign the check-out sheet that acknowledges responsibility for lost or broken Chromebooks. In addition, we are developing a list of resources to assist parents for securing wi-fi. Please remember to practice social distancing when picking up your Chromebook.




We encourage you to fill out the Google Form online to submit the Chromebook Sign-Out form electronically. You will then receive an email with a checkout ID that you will need to have when picking up a Chromebook. A parent will still need to be present to sign the Chromebook release form. https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSedy2TShlW3m3AQEBv7hFS4K5u3zXxAdqqiJG9XEAx8hzmQZA/viewform




For Chromebook assistance, please email chromebooks@sheltonschools.org or visit https://www.sheltonschools.org/departments/technology/chromebook_f_a_q



FOOD DISTRIBUTION

When picking up meals, please remain in your car.  We will bring the meals to you. Thank you for your cooperation!","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_4","title":"04/06/2020: School Closure Extension","content":"
Dear Families, Students, and Staff,







As you know, the Shelton School District has been closed over the past several weeks to help prevent the further spread of coronavirus in our community. This afternoon, Governor Inslee ordered an extension to the school closures in our state through the end of the school year.







The closures will continue to affect all Shelton School District programming, including before and after-school activities, all athletic and extracurricular practices and competitions, and all other events.







Our staff is in the process of finishing surveying each of our families to gather information so we can better understand your needs. Using this information, we will know how to best deliver instruction. After this process, preschool through eighth-grade staff will design lessons for both online access and packets for those who do not have internet. Grades nine through twelve will use a combination of an online learning platform and teacher-directed lessons. After Spring Break, you may expect to see all programs launched between April 15th and April 21st, or shortly thereafter.







Last week, our staff signed-out over 1,700 Chromebooks.  If you did not get a chance to sign-out a Chromebook, please let your teacher or advisor know when they contact you or send them an email so that we can determine what remaining need there is. 







Please be aware that meal services & childcare for students of first responders and essential health care providers will continue this week during Spring Break (April 6-10).







This has been an incredibly challenging time for the entire Shelton School District community. I want to thank you for your patience and understanding as we have dealt with this unprecedented situation. We will continue to keep you updated as new information arises.  







Once again, thank you.







Alex Apostle","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_5","title":"04/03/2020: Chromebook Sign-Outs/Assistance & Spring Break Services","content":"
This week, we served 6,736 meals & passed out 1,730 Chromebooks! Thank you to our dedicated staff for making this possible!



If you did not get a chance to sign-out a Chromebook this week, please let your teacher or advisor know when they contact you or send them an email so that we can determine what remaining need there is.




SPRING BREAK SERVICES

Please be aware that meal services & childcare for students of first responders and essential health care providers will continue next week during Spring Break (April 6-10).

CHROMEBOOK ASSISTANCE

For Chromebook login assistance, please email chromebooks@sheltonschools.org or see our Chromebook FAQ webpage.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_6","title":"04/02/2020: Chromebook Sign-Outs","content":"
The last day to sign-out a Chromebook is tomorrow, Friday, April 3, at all four of our food distribution sites. Chromebooks can be signed-out at ANY of the four distribution sites (you do not need to visit your home-school). Students who do not already have a computer or Chromebook for use at home may check one out. Please be aware that you must have internet access to use a Chromebook.  Parents must sign the check-out sheet that acknowledges responsibility for lost or broken Chromebooks. In addition, we are developing a list of resources to assist parents for obtaining WiFi. Please remember to practice social distancing when picking up your Chromebook. 



    
Food Distribution Sites:
    
        
Bordeaux Elementary: 9am-noon
        
Evergreen Elementary: 9am-noon
        
Olympic Middle School: 9am-noon
        
Shelton High School: 9am-noon

You may also fill out a Google Form online to submit the Chromebook Sign-Out form electronically.  You will then receive an email with a checkout ID that you will need to have when picking up a Chromebook.  A parent will still need to be present to sign the Chromebook release form.



Online Google Form

Need help with your Chromebook? CLICK HERE","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_7","title":"04/01/2020: Continuous Learning for All Students","content":"
Dear Families, Students, and Staff,

 

I hope this finds everyone healthy and safe. This is certainly a time when we are facing new challenges and situations that change daily. I want you to know that your health and safety continue to be extremely important as we move forward and make decisions that affect all of us.

 

The district has developed and started to implement a comprehensive plan for providing continuous learning for all students. Our kick-off was launching complementary educational resources on our website. On Tuesday, March 31st, we began the process of checking out Chromebooks to students and families. This will continue through Friday, April 3rd. As of today, we have provided approximately 1,350 Chromebooks for home use! We’re thrilled that we are able to provide this resource.

 

Moving forward, our staff will survey families to gather information so we can better understand your needs. You may also receive phone calls to help in this effort. Surveying will continue through Sunday, April 5th. Using this information, we will know how to best deliver instruction. After this process, kindergarten through eighth-grade staff will design lessons for both online access and packets for those who do not have internet. Grades nine through twelve will use a combination of an online learning platform and teacher-directed lessons. After Spring Break, you may expect to see all programs launched between April 15th and April 21st.

 

Our graduating seniors will continue to be a priority. We will have both an online option and a packet option for classes. Our goal is to place seniors first. The State Board of Education will be making decisions soon that will help us have a better understanding about requirements. We will continue to advocate for our students.

 

Please know that we are doing our very best to provide authentic, high-quality resources and lessons rather than sharing generic resources. This takes time.  We will continue to update our complementary resources on the district website, deliver breakfasts and lunches at our four school sites, provide childcare for first responders and healthcare workers, and communicate openly. This is truly a time to continue supporting each other and come together as a community, which we have.

 

Shelton Proud, Shelton Now!

 

Alex Apostle


CHROMEBOOK SIGN-OUTS

**For Chromebook login assistance, please email chromebooks@sheltonschools.org.



Chromebook distribution will continue through Friday, April 3, at all four of our food distribution sites. Students who do not already have a computer or Chromebook for use at home, may check one out. Please be aware that you must have internet access to use a Chromebook.  Parents must sign the check-out sheet that acknowledges responsibility for lost or broken Chromebooks. In addition, we are developing a list of resources to assist parents for obtaining WiFi. Please remember to practice social distancing when picking up your Chromebook.

    
Food Distribution Sites:
    
    
        
Bordeaux Elementary: 9am-noon
        
Evergreen Elementary: 9am-noon
        
Olympic Middle School: 9am-noon
        
Shelton High School: 9am-noon
    
    


    
Chromebook Sign-Out Forms:
    
    
        
Student Chromebook Sign Out Form.pdf
        
Formulario de Acceso a Chromebook Para Estudiantes 03.28.2020.pdf
    
    


You may also fill out a Google Form online to submit the Chromebook Sign-Out form electronically.  You will then receive an email with a checkout ID that you will need to have when picking up a Chromebook.  A parent will still need to be present to sign the Chromebook release form.

Online Google Form","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_8","title":"03/31/2020: Chromebook Sign-Outs","content":"
 

Chromebook Distribution Day #1 = Complete!

Thank you to our hardworking staff that has been cleaning and preparing Chromebooks over the past few days.  Today we were able to distribute around 1,000 Chromebooks! If you did not have a chance to sign one out today, we will be distributing Chromebooks through Friday at our meal distribution sites.  Parents must sign the check-out sheet that acknowledges responsibility for lost or broken Chromebooks. In addition, we are developing a list of resources to assist parents for securing wi-fi. For Chromebook login assistance, please email chromebooks@sheltonschools.org. We appreciate everyone for practicing social distancing during this time. Keep up the good work!

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_9","title":"03/30/2020: Resources","content":"
Resources for Families

A new webpage has been set up that contains an evolving collection of resources to help families during the coronavirus outbreak.  ","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_10","title":"03/28/2020: OSPI & KOMO 4 Resources","content":"
Dear Families and Students,

In the evening of March 27, 2020, The Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) released Resources for Continuous Learning During School Closures. It is a collection of high-quality online educational materials consisting of courses, lessons, videos, physical and outdoor activity suggestions, ect. The resources are in alignment with Washington State Learning Standards and use best practices in the delivery of the materials.

At this time, we are asking you to become familiar with the materials. In the following days, we will post specific lessons and directions for your students.

Please follow this link to the OSPI resources:

https://www.k12.wa.us/about-ospi/press-releases/novel-coronavirus-covid-19-guidance-resources/resources-continuous-learning-during-school-closures?fbclid=IwAR0vXw8rT8AwqbfgWYYYPEy11eV-1RDIgx8aTYiPpxbEkLE8hXtiFuTj8Do





Another resource for additional learning is through KOMO News 4. Seattle Public School District has posted many interactive lessons that are open for all students. Please be aware that there may be commercials and links to other sites when you are visiting the posted activities.

Please follow this link to Komo News 4 Lessons:

https://komonews.com/news/lesson-plan





We are aware and sensitive to the fact that not all of our families have access to the internet. Therefore, we are creating packets and developing a plan for distribution as soon as possible. Our educators are working together to provide additional instruction, guidance and outreach to families. Please watch our site for further communication.

Chromebook distribution will take place beginning Tuesday, March 31, at all four of our food distribution sites. Students who do not already have a computer or Chromebook for use at home, may check one out. Please be aware that you must have internet access to use a Chromebook.  Parents must sign the check-out sheet that acknowledges responsibility for lost or broken Chromebooks. In addition, we are developing a list of resources to assist parents for securing wi-fi. Please remember to practice social distancing when picking up your Chromebook.



    
Food Distribution Sites:
    
        
Bordeaux Elementary: 9am-noon
        
Evergreen Elementary: 9am-noon
        
Olympic Middle School: 9am-noon
        
Shelton High School: 9am-noon
    
    


    
Chromebook Sign-Out Forms:
    
        
Student Chromebook Sign Out Form.pdf
        
Formulario de Acceso a Chromebook Para Estudiantes 03.28.2020.pdf

        
    
    


 

Sincerely,

Alex Apostle","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_11","title":"03/26/2020: Looking Ahead","content":"
Dear Families and Students:



 

Last week, our focus was on basic needs by providing meals, childcare for families of medical workers and first responders, and ensuring safety through social distancing. Our next step was to begin providing complementary educational resources to families and students. You may find those resources on our webpage.

 

This week, we are broadening our focus to include planning in other areas for the weeks ahead. Currently, we are working on transcripting second trimester grades for high school students. Finals will not be required. We are also in the process of creating a plan for distance learning for all students. We will be surveying families shortly to establish internet and technology accessibility and needs as we plan these next steps. Distribution of Chromebooks will begin as soon as we can safely do so. Based on the complexity of this task and the need to involve our staff, we are targeting April 13th to begin new learning. Please watch for further communication.

 

New guidance from the Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) has been sent out around graduation requirements, and we are working closely with the state to prioritize meeting specific graduation requirement needs for seniors to ensure they graduate. The following is from OSPI’s Bulletin NO. 022-20 ES:

 

Credit Requirements

 

Washington’s high school diploma is based, in part, on completing a set number of high school credits. As a first step, district and school staff should determine which classes and credits seniors NEED to complete to meet credit requirements for graduation. This should include assessing the current class schedule for classes providing required senior-level credits (i.e., senior social studies, senior English), and courses meeting specific credit requirements that are serving a high number of seniors (such as third year math or science courses). This data can be sorted by number of seniors enrolled to prioritize coursework. Analysis should also include determining which classes and credits each senior needs to complete credit requirements for graduation. Schools should provide multiple options for seniors to demonstrate they have met standard across required content areas.

 

Please be assured that we as a district are quickly, but carefully, working our way through all requirements for our seniors. Our students will graduate on time.  

 

As a reminder, meals are limited to one (1) breakfast and one (1) lunch per child, per day. Please take only your share as we are working hard to provide as many meals as possible to every child in need.

 

The Shelton School District is dedicated to doing the very best for all of our students and families during this difficult time and we thank you for your patience as we work through this unique situation. We will continue to provide updates as new information arises.




Sincerely,




Alex Apostle","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_12","title":"03/23/2020: Complementary Resources, Chromebook Distribution Delay, & Childcare","content":"
COMPLEMENTARY RESOURCES

Complementary Educational Resources are now available to Shelton School District students and families. Included is a list of other educational activities that do not require technology. These are designed to help keep our students and families actively engaged in learning.



Printed lists of these resources and links are available for pick-up at our food distribution sites during the hours from 9:00-noon. 






CHROMEBOOKS



UPDATE: We are delaying the distribution of Chromebooks following the declaration from Governor Inslee’s order to “stay home and stay safe”.  Allowing a gathering of people at this time would violate the intent of the Governor’s guidance. We will resume the distribution of Chromebooks once the order is lifted. We are sorry for the inconvenience this might bring upon families, but safety is our number one priority. We will communicate any changes as soon as they happen.


CHILDCARE

We are currently providing childcare for students of first responders and essential health care providers. For questions or more information, please contact Maryann Marshall at mmarshall@sheltonschools.org or (360) 870-4662.



    
Childcare is held at Mt. View Elementary (534 E. K Street)
    
    
        
Hours of operation: 6:45 am to 7:15 pm
        
Ages 5 to 14 years
    
    
    
Breakfast and lunch are provided
    
    
        
For those staying later, parents are encouraged to send an evening meal or snack.
        
Medical staff will be checking temperatures and signs of illness prior to anyone entering the building.
    
    
    
Parents/guardians please call and schedule childcare before sending your children as we need to make sure we have enough staffing to support these needs.



DISTRICT FACILITIES ARE CLOSED 

All Shelton School District facilities and grounds are closed to use by the public, District staff, and students through April 24, 2020. Stadiums, fields, sport courts, parking lots, outdoor plazas, tracks, as well as all buildings are closed to everyone. This includes key holders. This is done for public safety and to help prevent transmission of the coronavirus. Please stay away from District Facilities or congregating in public spaces with others.


Grab & Go breakfast and lunch programs will still continue at Shelton High School, Olympic Middle School, Evergreen Elementary and Bordeaux Elementary from 9 AM - noon, Monday-Friday and are unaffected by closures. Also, childcare for healthcare providers and first responders will continue at Mountain View Elementary, Monday-Friday. The District also will be providing Chromebook pickup to students starting March 30th.



We thank you for doing your part to stay away from District facilities during the current closure. The physical health of our community is depending on us all to do our part.




REMINDER ABOUT MEALS

Meals are limited to one (1) breakfast and one (1) lunch per child, per day. We are working hard to provide as many meals as possible to every child in need.

 


STAY CONNECTED

Please visit our website often as we share new information daily. You can also opt-in to receive text messages by texting “Y” or “Yes” to 67587.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_13","title":"03/20/2020: Complementary Educational Resources","content":"
 


CLICK HERE for a video message from Dr. Apostle.






March 20, 2020



Dear Shelton School District Families

We are excited to share that the Shelton School District has a new webpage set up with Complementary Educational Resources for students and families to access at home while schools are closed. 



We understand there are many questions and concerns about keeping our students engaged in learning. We are working daily to remain up to date on both State and Federal guidance provided to school districts. During our time of school closure, guidance and direction may change daily or even hourly. Please know that we are monitoring communications and responding to rapidly changing situations.



Currently, the Shelton School District is unable to provide equitable distance learning opportunities to all of our students. We do not have the ability to provide 1:1 technology to all students, and not all students have access to the internet.  We must strive to remain equitable. As a result, we will not be providing direct educational instruction at this time. Any resources already sent home by teachers are optional and not required. Teachers at this time are not being directed to send home assignments or lessons through Google Classroom or any other platform. If this changes, we will communicate with you as soon as possible.

    
As of Friday, March 20, 2020, we are initiating Complementary Educational Resources to Shelton School District students and families. These are designed to keep our students and families actively engaged in learning.
    
Starting Monday, March 23, 2020, printed lists of these resources and links will be available for pick-up at our food distribution sites. This will include a list of other educational activities that do not require technology. 
    
Starting Monday, March 30 through Friday, April 3, we will be providing Chromebooks to all Shelton School District students if they wish to check one out.  Checking out a Chromebook is free of charge.  We ask that they be returned when school resumes. Chromebook sign-outs will take place at our food distribution sites.
    
        
Food Distribution Sites: Monday - Friday, 9:00-Noon
        
            
Bordeaux Elementary School
            
Evergreen Elementary School
            
Olympic Middle School
            
Shelton High School
        
        
    
    



The Shelton School District is dedicated to doing the very best for all of our students and families during this difficult time. Please check back frequently as we add more resources.



Stay healthy, focus on your families, and remain Shelton Strong.

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_14","title":"03/18/2020: Notice of Canceled Board Meetings, Meal Services, & Medication Pick-Ups","content":"

Notice of Canceled Board Meeting:

Please be advised that all scheduled meetings of the Shelton School District No. 309 Board of Directors have been canceled until further notice. This includes all regularly scheduled meetings remaining for the 2019-2020 school year.



Update on Meal Services:

Starting tomorrow, Thursday, March 19, ‘grab and go’ meals at the Shelton High School SUB will be accessed through the bus lane gate (the first gate closest to the Stadium).



Medication Pick-Up Reminder:

All schools will have staff members present today, Wednesday, March 18, from 5:00-7:00 PM and tomorrow,Thursday, March 19, from 11:00-1:30 PM for parents/caregivers to pick up medications left at school.



A staff member will be present outside of the main doors to greet you. Nobody is to enter the building. Please be patient and practice social distancing while our staff members assist you and retrieve your students’ medications.

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_15","title":"03/17/2020: Meal Services, Medication Pick-Ups, & Special Education Services","content":"
Update on Meals:



**STUDENTS MUST BE PRESENT TO RECEIVE MEALS PER CHILDREN NUTRITION GUIDELINES.



 As a reminder, FREE breakfast and lunch will be served to students and community members who are 18 years and younger in a ‘grab and go’ manner, set up at the Shelton High School Student Union Building (SUB) from 9 a.m-noon, Monday-Friday.



Starting on Wednesday, March 18, Bordeaux Elementary School, Evergreen Elementary School, and Olympic Middle School will ALSO be serving FREE breakfast and lunch to students and community members who are 18 years and younger in a ‘grab and go’ manner from 9 a.m-noon, Monday-Friday.


Medication Pick-Up:

All schools will have staff members present on Wednesday, March 18, from 5:00-7:00 PM and Thursday, March 19, from 11:00-1:30 PM for parents/caregivers to pick up medications left at school.



A staff member will be present outside of the main doors to greet you. Nobody is to enter the building. Please be patient and practice social distancing while our staff members assist you and retrieve your students’ medications.


Special Education Services:

If your child or young adult qualifies for a 504 plan or Individual Education Plan (IEP), when the district resumes educational services, those services will start immediately. If your child or young adult has an active evaluation, re-evaluation, or an IEP that will expire during the school closure, those activities will be prioritized by staff. Student and staff safety is paramount at this time, so we will be following social distancing as much as possible until school resumes. Updated information will be provided as it is received. If you would like to discuss anything further, please contact Jenny LaFrenier, Director of Special Education, at jlafrenier@sheltonschools.org.

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_16","title":"03/16/2020: Meal Services","content":"
Meal Services Update: FREE breakfast and lunch will be served to students and community members who are 18 years and younger in a ‘grab and go’ manner, set up at the Shelton High School Student Union Building (SUB) from 9 a.m-noon, Monday-Friday.
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_17","title":"03/13/2020: School Closure","content":"In a message sent earlier today (below) we stated that the Shelton School District would be closed “starting Monday, March 16 through at least Friday, April 10, 2020, and possibly longer if directed otherwise by the governor.” 



Following Governor Inslee’s order, announced during his 1:30 p.m. press conference, Shelton School District will be closed starting Monday, March 16 through at least Friday, April 24, 2020.



Again, we know this closure causes a great disruption for students, staff, families, and the entire community, but we are committed to working hard during this trying time to do our part and we appreciate your support.


Friday, March 13, 2020 - 1:30 p.m.



Dear Shelton School District Families, Staff, and Community,



Yesterday, Governor Jay Inslee announced that all K-12 schools in King, Pierce and Snohomish Counties are to be closed beginning Tuesday (or earlier at the school districts’ discretion) through at least April 24, 2020, in an effort to slow the spread of the coronavirus. 



After much discussion, the difficult decision was made to close the Shelton School District starting Monday, March 16 through at least Friday, April 24, 2020, and possibly longer if directed otherwise by the governor.  This includes all before and after school activities.



I know this closure causes a great disruption for students, staff, families, and the entire community. It was a difficult decision, but faced with the mounting challenges from the coronavirus, we have found ourselves in a situation like no other. This is a challenging time not only for our community but for the world. Now, more than ever, it is important to look out for one another, extend grace, and share smiles of encouragement. 



Family Services

We know that this extended closure will impact many of our families and we have protocols in place to support other student needs while our schools are closed.  These plans will change as the situation evolves and we will keep you updated.



Starting Monday, March 16, FREE breakfast and lunch will be served to students and community members who are 18 years and younger in a ‘grab and go’ manner, set up at the Shelton High School Student Union Building (SUB) from 9 a.m  - noon, Monday-Friday.  



We are finalizing plans on providing services for McKinney-Vento students

We are also finalizing plans for childcare for students of first responders and essential health care providers.  



Stay Connected

We will continue to provide regular updates on our Coronavirus Updates & Resources webpage. Please check our website frequently.  You will also find a Q & A webpage which we hope will answer many of your questions. There are still many unknowns, but we thank you for your patience, understanding, and support as we all work through this challenging time together.



Sincerely,



Superintendent, Dr. Alex Apostle","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_18","title":"03/02/2020: Mt. View Elementary Closed for Sanitation","content":"March 2, 2020



Today, we learned that a Mt. View Elementary School staff member’s spouse was a first responder at a COVID-19, Coronavirus outbreak at the Life Care Center in Kirkland. The first responder was notified that they would have to be quarantined at home, despite displaying no symptoms of the virus.



We immediately shared this information with the Mason County Public Health Department. Since the staff member had been in contact with their spouse prior to the quarantine, Mason County Public Health officials recommended that our staff member stay home as recommended by the Center of Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) of 14 days. In addition, Mt. View Elementary will be thoroughly sanitized starting this evening. This includes bringing in extra staff to sanitize every surface area including classrooms, restrooms, and other common areas of the school. 



To ensure the entire school is sanitized thoroughly and properly, Mt. View Elementary will be closed tomorrow, March 3, 2020. The staff member and spouse are not known to have the virus and do not display any symptoms. These measures are purely precautionary.



The Shelton School District is approaching this situation with an abundance of caution and is coordinating with the Mason County Health Department. Our custodial staff has also stepped up sanitation efforts in all of our schools and buses.



Our schools are re-emphasizing with our students and staff the importance of hand-washing. This is the best protection against disease transmission. The Department of Health also recommends that students cover their coughs and sneezes with a tissue and immediately wash their hands after disposing of the tissue. Students should also avoid touching their eyes, nose, and mouth as much as possible. Please visit with your child to make sure they understand the importance of these practices. For precautionary measures, students and staff who have fevers and coughs or any other flu-like symptoms should stay home until they are symptom-free for 24 hours without medication.



Once again, we would like to remind you that we are in constant communication with the Mason County Public Health Department regarding the coronavirus and will update parents, community and staff with any updates as needed.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl17_divTabs_19","title":"Coronavirus Resources","content":"
    
Washington State Department of Health: https://www.doh.wa.gov/ 
    
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC): https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html
    
Mason County Public Health: https://www.co.mason.wa.us/health/index.php
    
Just For Kids: A Comic Exploring The New Coronavirus: https://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2020/02/28/809580453/just-for-kids-a-comic-exploring-the-new-coronavirus

                        tabMode : tabM,
                        scrollToTabEdge: false, // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        disableScrollArrowsOnFullyScrolled: false // optional- pass in default value for demo purposes
                    }).on('ready.scrtabs', function() {
                        $('#'+this.id+' .tab-pane').attr('tabindex',0);
                    });
                };

                activate();
            }
        }

div.p: The Shelton School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employee has been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Linda Arnold, Director of Human Resources. 360-426-1687. 700 S. 1st Street; Shelton, WA 98584. Complaint procedure can be found on this website under Board Policy #3210 (students) and #5010 (employees).
